alert.note: Alert for Mitchell (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 11 at 12:09PM CDT until May 11 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTH CENTRAL MITCHELL COUNTY... At 1209 PM CDT, public rain gauge reports indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. These gauges measured between 3 and 5 inches of rain. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Osage, Mitchell, Highway 18 And County T 38 and Osage Spring Park. Rainfall rates have significantly diminished in the last 30 minutes. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
